column2: MISSISSIPPI PRACTICE PERMIT TEST
column4: Mississippi

column2: Question Text
column4: Answer1 Text

column2: 1. Which of the following substances can affect the ability to drive?
column4: Cold tablets containing codeine or antihistamines.

column2: 2. What is the slow moving vehicle symbol?
column4: A reflective orange triangle

column2: 3. If a driver follows you too closely, you should:
column4: move to another lane if possible.

column2: 4. This sign means:
column4: Hairpin corner ahead.

column2: 5. You hear a siren close by but can not see where the emergency vehicle is. What do you do?
column4: Pull over to the right side of the road and stop until you are sure the emergency vehicle is not headed toward you.
column6: Stop immediately and activate your emergency flashers.
column8: Keep driving until you are sure the emergency vehicle is headed toward you.

column2: 6. When driving in foggy weather, drivers should:
column4: put their lights on low beam.
column6: put their lights on high beam.

column2: 7. When passing another car, you have enough room to return to the driving lane when:
column4: you are at least 50 feet in front of the vehicle.
column6: you can see both headlights of the car you passed in your rearview mirror.
column8: you cannot see the vehicle directly to your right.

column2: 8. Blind spots are:
column4: Areas to the side or rear of a vehicle that the driver cannot see with use of mirrors.
column6: Dangerous intersection where the maximum speed limit is 15 MPH or less.
column8: At night, the darkest areas of a road, where emergency flashers should be used.

column2: 9. This sign means:
column4: The divided highway on which drivers are traveling ends ahead.
column6: Drivers are coming to a point where another traffic lane joins the one they are on.
column8: A road crosses the main highway ahead.

column2: 10. Which shape is a railroad advance warning sign?
column4: Round

column2: 11. If your car goes into water, you should:
column4: call the fire department immediately.
column6: remove yourself before it starts to sink.
column8: wait for water to rush in and let it out in small breaths through your nose.

column2: 12. This road sign warns drivers that:
column4: vehicles must leave the pavement immediately.
column6: the dirt on the side of the road is soft.
column8: the road surface ahead changes to a low-type surface or earth road.

column2: 13. In heavy rain, tires can begin to ride on the water that is on top of the road pavement. This is called:
column4: rideplaning.

column2: 14. If you've had a few beers, the effects of alcohol will be reduced only by:
column4: getting a cup of coffee.

column2: 15. At a crosswalk:
column4: pedestrians must yield to drivers.
column8: construction workers must yield to drivers.

column2: 16. How many different  classes of mopeds are there?
17. This sign means:
column4: The minimum speed limit is 45 MPH.
column6: Take route 45 if you are driving at night.
column8: The night-time speed limit is 45 MPH.

column2: 18. This road sign means:
column4: Watch for trucks entering from the side

column2: 19. This sign warns drivers that:
column4: right turns are not allowed.
column6: another road enters the highway from the direction shown.
column8: the road will make a sharp turn to the right.

column2: 20. This road sign means:
column4: You must travel at the speed indicated
column6: The maximum speed limit under ideal conditions

column2: 21. Alcohol:
column4: increases reaction time.
column6: makes drivers more prone to take chances.

column2: 22. Double solid lines on the roadway mean:
column4: you can not go across the lines except to turn left to enter or leave the highway.

column2: 23. When driving behind a motorcycle, drivers should:
column4: be ready to sound the horn.

column2: 24. At a stop sign there is no stop line or crosswalk. You must stop:
column4: after you enter the intersection, if you have a clear view of traffic on the intersecting roadway.

column2: 25. What does a flashing red light mean?
column4: Drivers may move forward with caution.
column6: The same thing as a stop sign.

column2: 26. This road sign:
column4: warns drivers that U-turns are not permitted.
column6: provides an advance notice of a roundabout.
column8: warns drivers of a sharp turn left. Drivers should slow their speed and keep to the left.

column2: 27. A driver who approaches an intersection:
column4: must drive straight through the intersection, even if another vehicle is already in the intersection.
column6: must yield the right-of-way to traffic already in the intersection.
column8: has the right-of-way over traffic already in the intersection.

column2: 28. Always driving slower than other traffic:
column4: is a good defensive driving technique.
column8: is always safer than driving faster than other traffic.

column2: 29. Some roadway surfaces are more slippery during certain times or at certain places. Which of the following is more likely to be slippery on cold, wet days?
column4: Roundabouts and traffic circles.

column2: 30. Who is most at risk?
column4: Drivers who are driving on long, boring roads.
